posts.raw_content:
The company I worked for decided after 25 years to close their doors. I've applied to over 700 jobs, had a few 1st round interviews, but I cannot get ANYONE to respond to me. Jobs I applied to months ago finally respond and go nowhere. I've had interviews setup and they no-show. 

I've been a safety director, operations manager, recruiter/recruiting manager, HR director, trainer, and have over 20 years of experience in trucking. I've been the President of a division of the Michigan Trucking Association and have devoted almost my entire career to the trucking industry (20 years). I've also worked in I/T, and had much lower level jobs before those, including door to door sales, telemarketing, retail etc. 

I cannot get a job to save my life. Nobody responds. Nobody calls back. My resume is excellent. My experience is excellent. I'm 46, male, and white. Every employer would give me high ratings, and I always worked at each place for no less than 5 years. 

Can someone please help me understand why this is the case? The job market is allegedly doing well, but I've never been unemployed for any period longer than 30 days in my entire life, even got laid off during the Obama recession and still found work with a temp service that led to much better opportunities. I've applied to deliver pizzas, work at gas stations, just to have something. I'm at my wits end and if it weren't for both the fact my wife makes decent money and we heavily invested, we'd be absolutely screwed right now.

My entire life, I've always worked hard, gone well above and beyond and it seems like none of that matters anymore. 

It is beyond upsetting and is driving a wedge between my wife and I because she can't understand. My brother in law is 50, has a master's and also is in the same boat. He was able to at least find a job dealing blackjack, but he's been searching and interviewing since last October with no success either.

Does anyone have any tricks up their sleeves? I'm not doing LinkedIn (the entire world doesn't need to know my business) and Indeed/ZipRecruiter are a complete waste of time. 

Short of going into business for myself, I don't know what else to do. The old days of finding jobs are long gone. You can't just walk in and ask to speak to someone. Everything is digital and NOBODY responds!!
posts.author: WarCry
posts.title: Been out of work for just over a year now
posts.content:
The company I worked for decided after 25 years to close their doors. I've applied to over 700 jobs, had a few 1st round interviews, but I cannot get ANYONE to respond to me. Jobs I applied to months ago finally respond and go nowhere. I've had interviews setup and they no-show.

I've been a safety director, operations manager, recruiter/recruiting manager, HR director, trainer, and have over 20 years of experience in trucking. I've been the President of a division of the Michigan Trucking Association and have devoted almost my entire career to the trucking industry (20 years). I've also worked in I/T, and had much lower level jobs before those, including door to door sales, telemarketing, retail etc.

I cannot get a job to save my life. Nobody responds. Nobody calls back. My resume is excellent. My experience is excellent. I'm 46, male, and white. Every employer would give me high ratings, and I always worked at each place for no less than 5 years.

Can someone please help me understand why this is the case? The job market is allegedly doing well, but I've never been unemployed for any period longer than 30 days in my entire life, even got laid off during the Obama recession and still found work with a temp service that led to much better opportunities. I've applied to deliver pizzas, work at gas stations, just to have something. I'm at my wits end and if it weren't for both the fact my wife makes decent money and we heavily invested, we'd be absolutely screwed right now.

My entire life, I've always worked hard, gone well above and beyond and it seems like none of that matters anymore.

It is beyond upsetting and is driving a wedge between my wife and I because she can't understand. My brother in law is 50, has a master's and also is in the same boat. He was able to at least find a job dealing blackjack, but he's been searching and interviewing since last October with no success either.

Does anyone have any tricks up their sleeves? I'm not doing LinkedIn (the entire world doesn't need to know my business) and Indeed/ZipRecruiter are a complete waste of time.

Short of going into business for myself, I don't know what else to do. The old days of finding jobs are long gone. You can't just walk in and ask to speak to someone. Everything is digital and NOBODY responds!!
